Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).subject: Physics (Electricity & Magnetism)
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).question: Television signal cannot be received generally beyond a particular distance due to
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).explanation: Curvature of the earth does not allow the television signals to be received beyond a particular distance.

Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).subject: Physics (Electricity & Magnetism)
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).question: By which one of the following, an old written material which cannot be read easily, can be read
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).explanation: Infrared rays helps in reading an old written material.

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: If a small raindrop falls through air
options: its velocity goes on increasing for sometime and then becomes constant
it falls with constant speed for sometime and then its velocity increases
Physics (Mechanics).answer: its velocity goes on increasing for sometime and then becomes constant
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: Velocity of raindrop increases until it reaches the terminal velocity.

Physics (Modern Physics).subject: Physics (Modern Physics)
Physics (Modern Physics).question:
Consider the following satements
X-rays
1. can pass through aluminum.
2. can be deflected by magnetic field.
3. move with a velocity less than the velocity of ultraviolet ray in vacuum.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
Physics (Modern Physics).explanation: X-rays cannot be deflected by magnetic field as they consists of no charge. X-rays and UV rays are electromagnetic wave, so they move with same velocity in vacuum i.e. 3 Ã— 108 m/s.
